citation.title: Speech-Language Impairments Rank First, Second Highest By Age

facebook.title: Speech-Language Impairments Rank First, Second Highest By Age
facebook.summary: According to the 37th Annual Report to Congress on the Implementation of the Individuals With Disabilities Education Act, speech or language impairments were the second- or third-most prevalent category for students ages 6-21 in every racial/ethnic group.

author.name: Longwood University Speech, Hearing & Learning Services
author.facebook_wall_name: Longwood University Speech, Hearing & Learning Services

facebook.title: Speech-Language Impairments Rank First, Second Highest By Age
facebook.summary: According to the 37th Annual Report to congress on the Implementation of the Individuals With Disabilities Education Act, speech or language impairments are the most prevalent disability category for children ages 3-5.
